qcnn module

Quantum Convolutional Neural Network.

qcnn.QCNN(num_qubits: int, num_measured: int, trans_inv: bool | None = True, qnn_ver: str | None = None) → Tuple[Callable, int, ndarray][source]

Construct Quantum Convolutional Neural Network architecture uing the specified QCNN version.

Parameters:

  • num_qubits (int) – Number of qubits in the QCNN.

  • num_measured (int) – Number of measured qubits at the end of the circuit. For L classes, we measure ceil(log2(L)) qubits.

  • trans_inv (bool, optional) – Boolean to indicate whether the QCNN is translational invariant or not. If True, all filters in a layer share identical parameters; otherwise, different parameters are used. (To be implemented) Default to True.

  • qnn_ver (str, optional) – Version of the quantum circuit architecture to be used. If set to None, the default architecture with U_TTN convolutional filters is used.

Returns:

Return a functionrepresenting the QCNN circuit, the total number of parameters in the circuit, and the list of wires measurment at the end of the circuit.

Return type:

Tuple[Callable, int, np.ndarray]

qcnn.choose_gate(gate_str: str) → Tuple[str, Callable, int, int][source]

Helper function to used to retrieve a specified convolutional filter (gate).

Parameters:

gate_str (str) – Name of the convolutional filter to be loaded.

Returns:

Tuple containing the name of the convolutional filter (given as args), the function representing the convolutional filter, the number of parameters in the filter and the number of wires on which the gate is applied.

Return type:

Tuple[str, Callable, int, int]

Example

>>> gate = choose_gate("U_TTN")
>>> print(gate)
    ('U_TTN', <function unitary.U_TTN(angle, wires)>, 2, 2)
